docs.text: Open source & Dutch public sector Open source gains popularity in the public sector of the Netherlands. This is a list of profiles on open source platforms in use by organizations in the Dutch public sector. Open source wint aan populariteit in de publieke sector van Nederland. Dit is een lijst met profielen op open source platforms die in gebruik zijn door organisaties in de Nederlandse publieke sector. Open source & Dutch public sector Organisations Ministries Provinces Municipalities Judiciary Emergency services and law enforcement Transport, Land, and Water Management Data and statistics Research Institutes Libraries Universities University Medical Centers University of Applied Sciences Contributing About Organisations Ministries High governmental organisations in the Netherlands headed by a Uitvoering (DICTU) GIS Competence Centre Ministerie van Infrastructuur en Milieu Ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid Nationaal Cyber Security Centrum (NCSC) Ministerie van Onderwijs, Cultuur en Wetenschap Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed Ministerie van Volksgezondheid, Welzijn en Sport Provinces The ‘middle tier’ of public administration in the Netherlands Groningen Noord-Holland Municipalities The public administration of municipalities in the Netherlands Amsterdam Delft Haarlem Nijmegen s-Hertogenbosch Utrecht Zaanstad Partnerships between municipalities: Vereniging van Nederlandse Gemeenten (VNG) Realisatie VNG Realisatie (GitHub) VNG Realisatie (GitLab) Common Ground Judiciary The judiciary power in the Netherlands Staten-Generaal Emergency services and law enforcement Emergency services and law enforcement in the Netherlands Nationale Politie Transport, Land, and Water Management Organisations in field of managing the public space Rijkswaterstaat Rijkswaterstaat 1 Rijkswaterstaat 2 Landelijke voorziening BAG Kadaster Labs PDOK (Publieke Diensten Op de Kaart) Data and statistics Organisations in field of national data and statistics Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek (CBS) (English: National Statistics) Dutch National Data portal (Data.overheid.nl) Research Institutes Research institutes in the Netherlands DANS-KNAW Huygens ING KNAW Digital Humanities Lab KNAW Humanities Cluster Netherlands eScience Center Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW) Rijksinstituut voor Volksgezondheid en Milieu (RIVM) Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI) TNO Libraries Libraries in the Netherlands National Library of the Netherlands (Koninklijke bibliotheek) Universities Universities in the Netherlands Universities can have many suborganizations. We aim to be inclusive. Erasmus University Rotterdam Erasmus University Library Rotterdam School of Management Groningen University Center for Information Technology & Educational Support and Innovation Geodienst High Performance Computing - Center for Information Technology Leiden University Leiden University Library Leiden University Centre for Innovation Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science (GitLab, self-hosted) Maastricht University Cognitive Computational Neuroscience DataHub Maastricht Institute of Data Science Maastricht Centre for Systems Biology Maastricht Law & Tech Lab Radboud University Radboud University (Open Science?) Faculty of Science (GitLab, self-hosted) Faculty of Social Sciences (GitLab self-hosted) NLP Research group at Centre for Language Studies Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour TU Delft (GitLab, self-hosted) 3D geoinformation Micro Air Vehicle Laboratory QuTech TU Eindhoven (GitLab, self-hosted) Robotics Group - RoboCup team Model Driven Software Engineering University of Amsterdam Computer Vision Deep Learning Faculteit der Natuurwetenschappen, Wiskunde en Informatica Minor programmeren University of Twente Formal Methods and Tools RoboCup team of the University of Twente Utrecht University Research IT Webdiensten Digital Humanities Lab Institute for Marine and Atmospheric research Utrecht Science Faculty (GitLab self-hosted) VU Amsterdam University Library 1 University Library 2 Software and Sustainability Group Instituut voor Milieuvraagstukken Wageningen University & Research (GitLab, self-hosted) Geo-scripting Production Ecology & Resource Conservation University Medical Centers University medical centers are hospitals with a close relationship between the medical faculty and the hospital AMC Erasmus Medical Center Bioinformatics Medical Informatics LUMC LUMC LUMC GitLab (GitLab, self-hosted) Radboud UMC UMC Groningen Medical Imaging Center UMC Utrecht Medical microbiology department Genetics Registration and Imaging of Brain Systems VUMC IT Tumor Genome Analysis Core Vanderbilt Institute for Clinical and Translational Research Clinical Genetics/Pathology University of Applied Sciences Universities of Applied Sciences (Dutch: hogescholen) in the Netherlands Haagse Hogeschool Technische Natuurkunde Hogeschool Rotterdam Beheer, Infrastructuur & Telecom Creative Media and Game Technologies Hogeschool Rotterdam Hogeschool Utrecht HU Institute for ICT Hogeschool Zeeland HBO - ICT Hogeschool der Kunsten Den Haag Contributing Your contributions are always welcome! Everyone with a Github account can add the details of missing institutes. No git skills required. It's super easy! Navigate to this link . Add the link. Use the format * [institution-name](http://example.com/) Add a section if needed (don't forget the description and Table of Contents). Create a Pull Request. No need to make an issue first. Make sure the PR title is in the format of Add institution-name . Submit Pull Request About Open software and open data is important for a transparent and efficient public sector. Many organizations in the public sector have open source activities. An example is the Dutch COVID-19 Notification App CoronaMelder by the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport . The PublicSectorNL project aims to make the accounts and projects of the Dutch public sector easily findable. Findability is the key to reuse and collaboration. The project is initiated and maintained by Jonathan de Bruin , Wouter van Bijsterveld , and Paul van Gent . The list of organizations is published under a CC-BY 4.0 license. We decided to write this repository in English because the content might be interesting for non-Dutch speaking developers, governments, organizations. Some organizations are more recognizable in Dutch and therefore enlisted by their Dutch name. In general, this project lists administrative organizations in Dutch and research institutes and medical centers in English. If relevant, a translation can be added. Inspired and technically based on awesome-python ( CC-BY 4.0 license ).

docs.text: Open software and open data is important for a transparent and efficient public sector. Many organizations in the public sector have open source activities. An example is the Dutch COVID-19 Notification App CoronaMelder by the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport . The PublicSectorNL project aims to make the accounts and projects of the Dutch public sector easily findable. Findability is the key to reuse and collaboration. The project is initiated and maintained by Jonathan de Bruin , Wouter van Bijsterveld , and Paul van Gent . The list of organizations is published under a CC-BY 4.0 license. We decided to write this repository in English because the content might be interesting for non-Dutch speaking developers, governments, organizations. Some organizations are more recognizable in Dutch and therefore enlisted by their Dutch name. In general, this project lists administrative organizations in Dutch and research institutes and medical centers in English. If relevant, a translation can be added. Inspired and technically based on awesome-python ( CC-BY 4.0 license ).
